results.title: The Long view
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The view from space has given us a total vision of our planet—a perspective and perception made possible through the development of remote-sensing technology in connection with Earth-orbiting satellites and aircraft. This film details some of the practical, down-to-earth applications of this technology and Canada’s activity in this field, particularly where it concerns the better management of natural resources and the environment. The capabilities are astonishing, and the need for responsible conservation is explicitly stated.

results.title: The Long riders [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Tim Zinnemann, United Artists Corporation and Huka Productions
results.brief_description: Walter Hill’s version of the infamous James-Younger gang, an outlaw group of veterans who terrorised Missouri and Minnesota in the immediate post-Civil War years, is a homage to the archetypal classic Westerns of Hollywood’s Classic era. The James-Younger Gang consisted of three sets of siblings (Jesse and Frank James, Cole, Jim and Bob Younger, and Ed and Clell Miller) and it is Walter Hill’s conceit with “The Long Riders” to have three sets of Hollywood siblings play the gang members (James and Stacy Keach play the James’; David, Keith and Robert Carradine are the Youngers; Randy and Dennis Quaid, the Millers). It can be seen that in many respects “The Long Riders”, made at the beginning of the 1980s, inaugurated Hollywood’s obsession in that decade for pastiche and uncritical homage as opposed to the revisionism of genre that dominated the American cinema of the early seventies. Beautifully shot by cinematographer Ric Waite, who uses the lush southern United States locales to recall the mythological terrain of the John Ford westerns, and featuring original music by Ry Cooder which is faithful to the musical legacy of the United States Civil War, “The Long Riders” is, for all the directness of its violence, language and sexual lives of the gang, very much a traditional western. Cast also includes Christopher Guest and Nicholas Guest as Charlie and Bob Ford respectively, Pamela Reed, Amy Stryker.

results.title: The Long line
results.creator_credit: Arnold Rabin, United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and Rank Screen Services
results.brief_description: This film is a comprehensive and dramatic account of the whole of the refugee problem. It includes sequences showing the escape of refugees across the Hungarian border, their experiences in camp and their final resettlement in their own homes. It also tells of the appointment of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and the formation of his office to handle refugee problems.

results.title: The Long kiss goodnight (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Renny Harlin, Shane Black, Stephanie Austin, Steve Tisch and Forge
results.brief_description: Samantha Cain (Geena Davis) is a school teacher who for the past 8 years has suffered amnesia. Haunted by bizarre flashbacks, she hires private detective Mitch (Samuel L. Jackson), to discover her true identity. They discover that Samantha is actually a lethal government assassin, presumed dead and that’s the way the authorities would like to keep it. Samantha is now hunted by her past and a string of government agents who have placed a contract on her life and kidnapped her daughter.

results.title: The Long journey
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Film Board and Rank Screen Services
results.brief_description: Was has left its mark on Korea. Three million refugees joined the ranks of the homeless and hungry and the countryside was maimed and scarred. This film tells of Kim Tai Yung, a farmer from North Korea and one of those refugees who made their way to the South and freedom in 1951. As a background to Kim’s gradual progress the task of United Nations rehabilitation and reconstruction is seen to take shape and move into action.

results.title: The Long hot summer
results.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Jerry Wald and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Paul Newman plays Ben Quick a suspected barnburner who drifts into a small Mississippi town intent on working to build a comfortable life for himself. He catches the eye of wealthy landowner Will Varner (Orson Welles) a tyrannical, intimidating patriarch who decides the determined young man would make an ideal husband for his feisty independant daughter Clara (Joanne Woodward) and ensure the survival of his empire. This provacative tale set in America’s Deep South simmers with sexual tension and a powerful clash of personalities. Co-starring Lee Remick and Angela Lansbury. Based on three stories by William Faulkner.

results.title: The Long haul men
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A drive with long-distance truckers freighting produce over highways between Mexico, the western States and Calgary. The film shows how the diversity of country and climate creates the daily experience of the truckers, and the link that this type of transport forms between different parts of the continent.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubbo, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Long Goodbye
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Jerry Bick and Lion's Gate Films
results.brief_description: Elliott Gould brilliantly follows, among others, Humphrey Bogart, to play the screen’s most famous private detective Phillip Marlowe and gives one of his best performances in this very enjoyable film which The Guardian described as “Bold and often beautifully made … a marvellously off-beat and eccentric thriller”. The witty and sophisticated screenplay is adapted from Raymond Chandler’s novel and is directed by Robert Altman with great flair and ingenuity as he skilfully combines suspense and comedy. Gould is supported by fine performances from Nina van Pallandt, Sterling Hayden, Mark Rydell and Henry Gibson.

results.title: The Long Good Friday
results.creator_credit: John Mackenzie, Barry Hanson, Calendar and HandMade Films
results.brief_description: In the savage and deadly world of gangland kings, the man at the top is the ruler, only for as long as he controls everything in his territory. For that man, the rewards are infinite - but so are the dangers. Harold Shand, played by Bob Hoskins, London racketeer, is at the peak of his powers. He is on the verge of a major deal with some Americans, to finance the total redevelopment of the London docklands into an enormous leisure complex. But on one long, never-ending day of terror, Good Friday, he is to see his empire crack and crumble. Co-starring Helen Mirren.

results.title: The Long distance search for the great Australian funny bone. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: John Woods and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: A variety of yarns and tall stories are told in this edited version of the search for the key to Australian humour. Includes animated sequences. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
